content.question: The ability of Luther’s Ninety-Five Theses to have a significant effect on Europe is best explained by which of the following?

choices.label: The refusal of some Protestants to subordinate the church to the state
The nobility using religious dissent to challenge monarchs’ power
The belief that increasing material prosperity in some Protestant countries was a sign of God’s favor
The use of the newly developed printing press to rapidly spread Protestant ideas

content.answer: The use of the newly developed printing press to rapidly spread Protestant ideas

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
